title: Do you guys feel Nexus Blitz was successful enough for it to remain permanent?
body: Do you guys feel Nexus Blitz was successful enough for it to remain permanent? When do you guys think we can play Nexus Blitz again?

replies.body: I think league needs a shorter game mode such as dominion or nexus blitz more than the other way around. The biggest problem with summoner's rift is that riot is trying to stretch it too thin. They need a shorter map to retain players who want 20 minute games without compromising summoner's rift.

Dominion and Ascension was my favorite modes, however, at one point, Riot said that the player base of Twisted Tree line was very low a few months ago, but still a lot better than the player base of what Dominion used to be. As much as I like the mode, to ask Riot to keep it up at such lower player base makes me feel kind of guilty. I still wish everyday I could play Dominion or Ascension everyday, but they do have a valid reason for not upkeeping it. On a scale of 1 to 10 where 5.5 is considered "average", I'd give Nexus Blitz a 6.5 out of 10. Aram 4 out of 10, Rift 2.5 out of 10. Of course, Dominion/Ascension to me was 9 out of 10, but I can't be selfish and just ask them to keep it, they're a business afterall.

> [{quoted}](name=XxDRAGONsAK47xX,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QA7NFUJh,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2019-01-07T13:33:54.761+0000)

> Its been almost 2 years since Ascension was last available. ALMOST 2 FUCKING YEARS.

I miss this and nexus siege.

I think it has potential! I found it really fun the first time it was on live servers, but not as much the second time. Don’t get me wrong, it’s still fun, but it obviously needs changes if it’s gonna become a permanent mode. First of all I think the GA reward needs to go. Nothing is more tilting than losing the first event and the enemy team getting GA’s that early on. I also don’t care for the paranoia event, but that could jsut be personal preference. Also if they are going to make it permanent they would/should look at mode specific balance changes to some champions. Now that the mode has been out for a while between both of its visits to the live servers, people are starting to figure out what champions are really good and just spamming them.

Personally? I think it was extremely fun at first but after doing the quests specifically for blitz I felt no desire to play it again. Last time it released I thought it was just trash, so it has improved massively in the second iteration. Perhaps a 3.0 version could hold my interest for longer but there's lots of work that needs to be done. Now that it's been out a month and a meta was starting to form and the wackiness has sort of dulled to those of us who have been playing, I'm not sure I would really ever play it again in its current state.

When can we play other games again??? 

Its been almost 2 years since Ascension was last available. ALMOST 2 FUCKING YEARS.

I like it for the most part, yes It can be unbalanced, but it's a nice change of gameplay. I hope they make It a permanent mode, but I highly doubt it will happen. From what I read, people don't like changes at all... URF make people stop playing the game, people don't like reworks, but yet the same hope for reworks. Sometimes I'm sick of only playing Summoner's rift, Nexus Blitz can help me make my games different. I guess change is bad?

I don't think it is fit to be a permanent game mode.
It's to feast or famine to be fun in the long run and poeple already tryhard on it by doing stuff like herald (shouldn't even be here in the first place imo)

The fact it's the best mode to earn pass token without random pick also kinda screw the popularity data of the queue (would have prefer 3v3 if it was an option for exemple)

It's a snowballing clown fiesta coin flip with no balance, and I hope Riot shelves it because it's fucking horrific.

But I know it'll be back, with more missions forcing you to play it or miss out on special unique limited-time rewards... God I hate that stupid trend that every game nowadays has to try to addict people instead of just BE FUCKING FUN.
